info.title: RedisEnterpriseManagementClient
info.description: REST API for managing Redis Enterprise resources in Azure.

get.description: Lists all of the available REST API operations of the Microsoft.Cache provider.

parameters.name: operationId
parameters.description: The ID of an ongoing async operation.

get.description: Lists all Redis Enterprise clusters in the specified subscription.
Lists all Redis Enterprise clusters in a resource group.
Gets information about a Redis Enterprise cluster

parameters.name: clusterName
parameters.description: The name of the Redis Enterprise cluster. Name must be 1-60 characters long. Allowed characters(A-Z, a-z, 0-9) and hyphen(-). There can be no leading nor trailing nor consecutive hyphens

put.description: Creates or updates an existing (overwrite/recreate, with potential downtime) cache cluster

parameters.name: clusterName
parameters.description: The name of the Redis Enterprise cluster. Name must be 1-60 characters long. Allowed characters(A-Z, a-z, 0-9) and hyphen(-). There can be no leading nor trailing nor consecutive hyphens

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Create Redis Enterprise operation.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

patch.description: Updates an existing Redis Enterprise cluster

parameters.name: clusterName
parameters.description: The name of the Redis Enterprise cluster. Name must be 1-60 characters long. Allowed characters(A-Z, a-z, 0-9) and hyphen(-). There can be no leading nor trailing nor consecutive hyphens

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the Update Redis Enterprise operation.

Azure-AsyncOperation.description: A link to the status monitor

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

delete.description: Deletes a Redis Enterprise cache cluster.

parameters.name: clusterName
parameters.description: The name of the Redis Enterprise cluster. Name must be 1-60 characters long. Allowed characters(A-Z, a-z, 0-9) and hyphen(-). There can be no leading nor trailing nor consecutive hyphens

Location.description: The Location header contains the URL where the status of the long running operation can be checked.

Retry-After.description: The Retry-After header can indicate how long the client should wait before polling the operation status.

post.description: Forcibly recreates an existing database on the specified cluster, and rejoins it to an existing replication group. **IMPORTANT NOTE:** All data in this database will be discarded, and the database will temporarily be unavailable while rejoining the replication group.

parameters.name: clusterName
parameters.description: The name of the Redis Enterprise cluster. Name must be 1-60 characters long. Allowed characters(A-Z, a-z, 0-9) and hyphen(-). There can be no leading nor trailing nor consecutive hyphens

AccessKeys.description: The secret access keys used for authenticating connections to redis

primaryKey.description: The current primary key that clients can use to authenticate

secondaryKey.description: The current secondary key that clients can use to authenticate

AccessKeysAuthentication.description: This property can be Enabled/Disabled to allow or deny access with the current access keys. Can be updated even after database is created.

AccessPolicyAssignment.description: Describes the access policy assignment of Redis Enterprise database

properties.description: Properties of the access policy assignment.

AccessPolicyAssignmentList.description: The response of a list-all operation.

value.description: The AccessPolicyAssignment items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

AccessPolicyAssignmentProperties.description: Properties of Redis Enterprise database access policy assignment.

provisioningState.description: Current provisioning status of the access policy assignment.

accessPolicyName.description: Name of access policy under specific access policy assignment. Only "default" policy is supported for now.

user.description: The user associated with the access policy.

AccessPolicyAssignmentPropertiesUser.description: The user associated with the access policy.

objectId.description: The object ID of the user.

AofFrequency.description: Sets the frequency at which data is written to disk. Defaults to '1s', meaning 'every second'. Note that the 'always' setting is deprecated, because of its performance impact.

AzureCacheForRedisMigrationProperties.description: Properties for Redis Enterprise migration operation for Azure Cache for Redis.

sourceResourceId.description: The source resource ID to migrate from. This is the resource ID of the Azure Cache for Redis.

switchDns.description: Sets whether the DNS is switched automatically after the data is transferred from the source cache to the target cache. This property must be true during the preview.

skipDataMigration.description: Sets whether the data is migrated from source to target or not. This property must be true during the preview.

kind.description: Distinguishes the kind of cluster. Read-only.

sku.description: The SKU to create, which affects price, performance, and features.

ClusterCreateProperties.description: Properties of Redis Enterprise clusters for create operations

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public network traffic can access the Redis cluster. Only 'Enabled' or 'Disabled' can be set. null is returned only for clusters created using an old API version which do not have this property and cannot be set.

ClusterList.description: The response of a list-all operation.

value.description: The Cluster items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

ClusterProperties.description: Properties of Redis Enterprise clusters, as opposed to general resource properties like location, tags

highAvailability.description: Enabled by default. If highAvailability is disabled, the data set is not replicated. This affects the availability SLA, and increases the risk of data loss.

minimumTlsVersion.description: The minimum TLS version for the cluster to support, e.g. '1.2'. Newer versions can be added in the future. Note that TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 are now completely obsolete -- you cannot use them. They are mentioned only for the sake of consistency with old API versions.

hostName.description: DNS name of the cluster endpoint

provisioningState.description: Current provisioning status of the cluster

redundancyMode.description: Explains the current redundancy strategy of the cluster, which affects the expected SLA.

resourceState.description: Current resource status of the cluster

redisVersion.description: Version of redis the cluster supports, e.g. '6'

privateEndpointConnections.description: List of private endpoint connections associated with the specified Redis Enterprise cluster

customerManagedKeyEncryption.description: All Customer-managed key encryption properties for the resource. Set this to an empty object to use Microsoft-managed key encryption.

ClusterPropertiesEncryptionCustomerManag.description: All Customer-managed key encryption properties for the resource. Set this to an empty object to use Microsoft-managed key encryption.

keyEncryptionKeyIdentity.description: All identity configuration for Customer-managed key settings defining which identity should be used to auth to Key Vault.

keyEncryptionKeyUrl.description: Key encryption key Url, versioned only. Ex: https://contosovault.vault.azure.net/keys/contosokek/562a4bb76b524a1493a6afe8e536ee78

ClusterPropertiesEncryptionCustomerManag.description: All identity configuration for Customer-managed key settings defining which identity should be used to auth to Key Vault.

userAssignedIdentityResourceId.description: User assigned identity to use for accessing key encryption key Url. Ex: /subscriptions/<sub uuid>/resourceGroups/<resource group>/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/myId.

identityType.description: Only userAssignedIdentity is supported in this API version; other types may be supported in the future

ClusterUpdate.description: A partial update to the Redis Enterprise cluster

sku.description: The SKU to create, which affects price, performance, and features.

ClusterUpdateProperties.description: Properties of Redis Enterprise clusters for update operations

publicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public network traffic can access the Redis cluster. Only 'Enabled' or 'Disabled' can be set. null is returned only for clusters created using an old API version which do not have this property and cannot be set.

ClusteringPolicy.description: Clustering policy - default is OSSCluster. This property can be updated only if the current value is NoCluster. If the value is OSSCluster or EnterpriseCluster, it cannot be updated without deleting the database.

values.name: EnterpriseCluster
values.description: Enterprise clustering policy uses only the classic redis protocol, which does not support redis cluster commands.

values.name: OSSCluster
values.description: OSS clustering policy follows the redis cluster specification, and requires all clients to support redis clustering.

values.name: NoCluster
values.description: The NoCluster policy is used for non-clustered Redis instances that do not require clustering features.

CmkIdentityType.description: Only userAssignedIdentity is supported in this API version; other types may be supported in the future

Database.description: Describes a database on the Redis Enterprise cluster

DatabaseCreateProperties.description: Properties for creating Redis Enterprise databases

accessKeysAuthentication.description: This property can be Enabled/Disabled to allow or deny access with the current access keys. Can be updated even after database is created. Default is Disabled.

DatabaseList.description: The response of a list-all operation.

value.description: The Database items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

DatabaseProperties.description: Properties of Redis Enterprise databases, as opposed to general resource properties like location, tags

clientProtocol.description: Specifies whether redis clients can connect using TLS-encrypted or plaintext redis protocols. Default is TLS-encrypted.

port.description: TCP port of the database endpoint. Specified at create time. Defaults to an available port.

provisioningState.description: Current provisioning status of the database

resourceState.description: Current resource status of the database

clusteringPolicy.description: Clustering policy - default is OSSCluster. This property can be updated only if the current value is NoCluster. If the value is OSSCluster or EnterpriseCluster, it cannot be updated without deleting the database.

evictionPolicy.description: Redis eviction policy - default is VolatileLRU

modules.description: Optional set of redis modules to enable in this database - modules can only be added at creation time.

geoReplication.description: Optional set of properties to configure geo replication for this database.

redisVersion.description: Version of Redis the database is running on, e.g. '6.0'

deferUpgrade.description: Option to defer upgrade when newest version is released - default is NotDeferred. Learn more: https://aka.ms/redisversionupgrade

accessKeysAuthentication.description: This property can be Enabled/Disabled to allow or deny access with the current access keys. Can be updated even after database is created.

keySpaceNotification.description: Specifies which keyspace events should trigger notifications. Default is an empty string, meaning this feature is disabled. When enabled, at least 'K' (keyspace events) or 'E' (keyevent events) must be present. For example, 'AKE' enables all standard events. See https://redis.io/docs/latest/develop/use/keyspace-notifications/ for the complete list of event types.

DatabasePropertiesGeoReplication.description: Optional set of properties to configure geo replication for this database.

groupNickname.description: Name for the group of linked database resources

linkedDatabases.description: List of database resources to link with this database

DatabaseUpdate.description: A partial update to the Redis Enterprise database

DatabaseUpdateProperties.description: Properties for updating Redis Enterprise databases

accessKeysAuthentication.description: This property can be Enabled/Disabled to allow or deny access with the current access keys. Can be updated even after database is created. Default is Disabled.

DeferUpgradeSetting.description: Option to defer upgrade when newest version is released - default is NotDeferred. Learn more: https://aka.ms/redisversionupgrade

EvictionPolicy.description: Redis eviction policy - default is VolatileLRU

ExportClusterParameters.description: Parameters for a Redis Enterprise export operation.

sasUri.description: SAS URI for the target directory to export to

FlushParameters.description: Parameters for a Redis Enterprise active geo-replication flush operation

ids.description: The identifiers of all the other database resources in the georeplication group to be flushed.

items.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

ForceLinkParameters.description: Parameters for reconfiguring active geo-replication, of an existing database that was previously unlinked from a replication group.

geoReplication.description: Properties to configure geo replication for this database.

ForceLinkParametersGeoReplication.description: Properties to configure geo replication for this database.

groupNickname.description: The name of the group of linked database resources. This should match the existing replication group name.

linkedDatabases.description: The resource IDs of the databases that are expected to be linked and included in the replication group. This parameter is used to validate that the linking is to the expected (unlinked) part of the replication group, if it is splintered.

ForceUnlinkParameters.description: Parameters for a Redis Enterprise Active Geo Replication Force Unlink operation.

ids.description: The resource IDs of the database resources to be unlinked.

items.description: A type definition that refers the id to an Azure Resource Manager resource.

HighAvailability.description: Enabled by default. If highAvailability is disabled, the data set is not replicated. This affects the availability SLA, and increases the risk of data loss.

ImportClusterParameters.description: Parameters for a Redis Enterprise import operation.

sasUris.description: SAS URIs for the target blobs to import from

Kind.description: Distinguishes the kind of cluster. Read-only.

LinkState.description: State of the link between the database resources.

LinkedDatabase.description: Specifies details of a linked database resource.

id.description: Resource ID of a database resource to link with this database.

state.description: State of the link between the database resources.

maintenanceWindows.description: Custom maintenance windows that apply to the cluster.

MaintenanceDayOfWeek.description: Day of week. Required when the maintenance window type is 'Weekly'.

duration.description: Duration in ISO-8601 format, for example 'PT5H'.

startHourUtc.description: Start hour (0-23) in UTC when the maintenance window begins.

schedule.description: Recurring schedule for the maintenance window.

MaintenanceWindowSchedule.description: Schedule details for a maintenance window.

dayOfWeek.description: Day of week. Required when the maintenance window type is 'Weekly'.

Migration.description: Describes the current migration operation on a Redis Enterprise cluster.

MigrationList.description: The response of a list-all migrations.

value.description: The Migration items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

MigrationProperties.description: Properties for Redis Enterprise migration operation.

sourceType.description: Describes the source of the migration operation.

targetResourceId.description: The Azure resource ID of the Azure Managed Redis destination cache to migrate.

provisioningState.description: Current provisioning status of the migration

statusDetails.description: Additional details about the migration operation's status in free text format.

creationTime.description: The timestamp when the migration operation was created.

lastModifiedTime.description: The timestamp when the migration operation was last updated.

values.name: Accepted
values.description: The request has been accepted and the migration operation is being initialized.

values.name: InProgress
values.description: The migration operation is in progress.

values.name: ReadyForDnsSwitch
values.description: The migration operation has completed transferring data and is ready for DNS switch.

values.name: Succeeded
values.description: The migration operation has completed successfully.

values.name: Cancelling
values.description: The migration operation is being cancelled.

values.name: Cancelled
values.description: The migration operation has been cancelled.

Module.description: Specifies configuration of a redis module

name.description: The name of the module, e.g. 'RedisBloom', 'RediSearch', 'RedisTimeSeries'

args.description: Configuration options for the module, e.g. 'ERROR_RATE 0.01 INITIAL_SIZE 400'.

version.description: The version of the module, e.g. '1.0'.

OperationStatus.description: The status of a long-running operation.

startTime.description: The start time of the operation.

endTime.description: The end time of the operation.

status.description: The current status of the operation.

error.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

Persistence.description: Persistence-related configuration for the Redis Enterprise database

aofEnabled.description: Sets whether AOF is enabled. Note that at most one of AOF or RDB persistence may be enabled.

rdbEnabled.description: Sets whether RDB is enabled. Note that at most one of AOF or RDB persistence may be enabled.

aofFrequency.description: Sets the frequency at which data is written to disk. Defaults to '1s', meaning 'every second'. Note that the 'always' setting is deprecated, because of its performance impact.

rdbFrequency.description: Sets the frequency at which a snapshot of the database is created.

PrivateEndpointConnectionListResult.description: The response of a PrivateEndpointConnection list operation.

value.description: The PrivateEndpointConnection items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

Protocol.description: Specifies whether redis clients can connect using TLS-encrypted or plaintext redis protocols. Default is TLS-encrypted.

PublicNetworkAccess.description: Whether or not public network traffic can access the Redis cluster. Only 'Enabled' or 'Disabled' can be set. null is returned only for clusters created using an old API version which do not have this property and cannot be set.

RdbFrequency.description: Sets the frequency at which a snapshot of the database is created.

RedundancyMode.description: Explains the current redundancy strategy of the cluster, which affects the expected SLA.

values.name: None
values.description: No redundancy. Availability loss will occur.

RegenerateKeyParameters.description: Specifies which access keys to reset to a new random value.

Sku.description: SKU parameters supplied to the create Redis Enterprise cluster operation.

name.description: The level of Redis Enterprise cluster to deploy. Possible values: ('Balanced_B5', 'MemoryOptimized_M10', 'ComputeOptimized_X5', etc.). For more information on SKUs see the latest pricing documentation. Note that additional SKUs may become supported in the future.

capacity.description: This property is only used with Enterprise and EnterpriseFlash SKUs. Determines the size of the cluster. Valid values are (2, 4, 6, ...) for Enterprise SKUs and (3, 9, 15, ...) for EnterpriseFlash SKUs.

SkuDetails.description: Details of a Redis Enterprise cluster SKU.

SkuDetailsList.description: The response of a listSkusForScaling operation.

skus.description: List of SKUS available to scale up or scale down.

SkuName.description: The level of Redis Enterprise cluster to deploy. Possible values: ('Balanced_B5', 'MemoryOptimized_M10', 'ComputeOptimized_X5', etc.). For more information on SKUs see the latest pricing documentation. Note that additional SKUs may become supported in the future.

SourceType.description: Describes the source of the migration operation.

values.name: AzureCacheForRedis
values.description: Migration from Azure Cache for Redis to Redis Enterprise.

TlsVersion.description: The minimum TLS version for the cluster to support, e.g. '1.2'. Newer versions can be added in the future. Note that TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 are now completely obsolete -- you cannot use them. They are mentioned only for the sake of consistency with old API versions.
